summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeGive BackBubble's Magic Melt Micellar Milk gently removes makeup, oil, and SPF to reveal calm, nourished skin. The soft milky texture is ideal for dry/sensitive faces, and it wipes away easily with a cloth or reusable makeup pad. Use Magic Melt on its own or as the first step of a double (or triple) cleanse.
details: DetailsBenefitsLeaves skin feeling clean, not strippedEasily wipes away with no residueIdeal for dry/sensitive skinKey IngredientsOat Extract helps soothe skin.Meadowfoam Seed Oil locks in hydration and regulates moisture levels.Raspberry Seed Oil helps provide essential vitamins and gently removes makeup.Formulated WithoutDenatured alcoholsAdded fragranceArtificial colorItem 2626626How To UseTo remove makeup or SPF, gently smooth over your face, eyes, and lips with your fingers (spending extra time on heavily made-up areas). Once makeup or SPF has broken down, wipe clean or rinse off. Follow with your favorite Bubble cleanser.IngredientsWater (Aqua), C15-19 Alkane, CetylEthylhexanoate, Glycerin, Isopropyl SheaButterate, Lauryl Glucoside, MyristylGlucoside, Polyglyceryl-6 Laurate,Tocopheryl Acetate, Avena Sativa (Oat)Kernel Extract, Limnanthes Alba(Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Rubus Idaeus(Raspberry) Seed Oil, Cetearyl Alcohol,Dodecane, Hexadecane, Xanthan Gum,Citric Acid, Sodium Phytate, HydroxyethylAcrylates/Sodium AcryloyldimethylTaurate Copolymer, Sorbitan Isostearate,Ethylhexylglycerin, Phenoxyethanol.
how_to_use: To remove makeup or SPF, gently smooth over your face, eyes, and lips with your fingers (spending extra time on heavily made-up areas). Once makeup or SPF has broken down, wipe clean or rinse off. Follow with your favorite Bubble cleanser.

reviews.headline: Not good
reviews.comments: The product melts makeup just fine but I hated the milky texture. The pump would often get stuck too which made it hard to use. Overall, I wouldn't buy this again.

reviews.headline: Sorry but this product was one of the worst bubble skintare.
reviews.comments: Me and mommy don ot like thi becus its bed.

reviews.headline: Wonderful Product, Butâ€¦
reviews.comments: I love this cleanser to death but the packaging is awful. Pump is difficult to press down, pump cap often falls off, sometimes product lid gets unscrewed and it can leak so easily. Really hope the fix the packaging. I will probably end up purchaing a pump container to move it into.

reviews.headline: Perfect Makeup Remover
reviews.comments: I usually use oil cleansers for removing my makeup, but they usually sting my eyes and I find myself running out quickly. However, I decided to try this product out and it's very gentle on the skin and eyes. I only have to use little product in order to take off my makeup!

reviews.headline: BEST MAKEUP REMOVER ðŸ§¡
reviews.comments: Bubble's Magic Melt Mirallur Water is a total game-changer! It melts away makeup and dirt while leaving my skin soft, hydrated, and glowyâ€”not dry or tight. The texture is silky and lightweight, and the clean scent is so refreshing. Obsessed with how gentle yet effective it is!

reviews.headline: Dried out my face
reviews.comments: Removed makeup fairly well but it dried my face out really badly even using moisturizer each time I used it.

reviews.headline: Packaging is so horrible
reviews.comments: The packaging is the worst thing I've ever seen The ring that makes it so the top come off by pulling it it broke and now i have to screw it off and pour it on my hand! But not only that the rube conectwd to the pump broke of!ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡ðŸ˜¡

reviews.headline: i love this sm!
reviews.comments: i love this product so much! it is really good for taking off makeup! one downside is after you use it a couple of times, the product does get a bit diffucult to open!

reviews.headline: i love this sm!
reviews.comments: i love this product so much! it is really good for taking off makeup! one downside is after you use it a couple of times, the product does get a bit diffucult to open!

reviews.headline: Sensitive skin girlies beware
reviews.comments: After reading all the great reviews I purchased this product. Unfortunately I had an allergic reaction to one of the ingredients in this product that made my face break out in hives. Just make sure if you have allergies/ super sensitve skin be weary!

reviews.headline: Doesn't work
reviews.comments: I gave this a try to help me remove my makeup before cleansing my face but it doesnt work. I still have a lot of makeup left on my face after rinsing it off

reviews.headline: I do not like it made my face burn
reviews.comments: I do not like it it made my face burn and turned my face beat red for 2 hours. It also makes your skin feel so oily and I do not have sensitive skin and it made my face so irritated and poor. I love bubble products but I do not like this one sadly but I thought I would

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: Got this for my 9 yr old daughter that wanted to start a skin care regimen, she don't wear makeup everyday but she likes to play with it so this was a great additionâ€¦

reviews.headline: Hard pass
reviews.comments: I like this brand, but I don't like some of their products I've tried, this one included. It felt like I was rubbing watered down lotion on my face and didn't help much with make up removal. Had to return - there's far better options from other brands.

reviews.headline: Ehâ€¦
reviews.comments: This product irritated my skin and I felt a bit of a burning sensation. The skin under my eyes was red and one was puffy. I've never had a makeup remover like this that has done that to my skin before. I may be allergic to something in it.

reviews.headline: AMAZING
reviews.comments: I use makeup alot, and this SAVED me. I triple cleanse. I use this, then native cleanser, then i mix them and its a LIFESAVER.

reviews.headline: Just OK
reviews.comments: This is an oily milk with a medium runny consistency that kinda reminds me of white school glue, but with more slip. It doesn't have an offensive odor, and initially I liked that it has a pump. However, the pump top broke about 60% of the way through the bottle. It does remove makeup, but not with fingers and water alone. I have to wet a cotton pad or use a cloth to remove it or my makeup won't come off all the way. I know I'm using it properly, so it's not user error. I don't appreciate the extra steps or the broken pump. I'll stick with my garnier water pink cap.

reviews.headline: Really good, BUT
reviews.comments: Its really good but if you got combo-dry skin with acne prone skin this might not be that good. I feel like it removed my makeup BUT i did start breaking out and geting black heads when im not prone to blackheads. I would use with caution. Will stop use and see if this was the cause since i did start using the MILK primer as well.

reviews.headline: I would 100% buy this again
reviews.comments: I LOVE this product!! It just melts your makeup off and feels so good and refreshing on the face. I would definitely buy this Several times again!

reviews.headline: Makeup
reviews.comments: it removed my make up really good, I dont know what yall where talking about but if you have oily skin it makes you skin red, I love it but I can't use it.

faceoff_positive.comments: Using Bubble's Magic Melt Micellar Milk has been a delightful addition to my skincare routine. The micellar milk effectively melts away makeup and impurities without the need for harsh rubbing. Its creamy, milky texture feels soothing on the skin, and it effortlessly lifts dirt and makeup, including waterproof mascara. After application, my skin feels clean, refreshed, and surprisingly hydrated, with no tightness or residue left behind. The gentle, nourishing formula is ideal for my sensitive skin, leaving it calm and balanced. Incorporating this micellar milk into my daily regimen has made makeup removal a much more pleasant and efficient process.
faceoff_positive.headline: Must have

faceoff_negative.comments: This is an oily milk with a medium runny consistency that kinda reminds me of white school glue, but with more slip. It doesn't have an offensive odor, and initially I liked that it has a pump. However, the pump top broke about 60% of the way through the bottle. It does remove makeup, but not with fingers and water alone. I have to wet a cotton pad or use a cloth to remove it or my makeup won't come off all the way. I know I'm using it properly, so it's not user error. I don't appreciate the extra steps or the broken pump. I'll stick with my garnier water pink cap.
faceoff_negative.headline: Just OK
